It won't even tell you that its charging you (you don't have play the game, all you have to do is open the page to be charged). Lame!! I was excited to check this place out and I'm excited not to come back.

Absolutely the worse seven meals ordered.  One hamburger still mooing. Sent back same patty was returned cremated and placed on the grill after it was bitten into possibly allowing germs to be transmitted. Another meal was a chicken sandwich.  Chicken was still frozen when presented at the table. Waiter did an excellent job. No more Chili's for this group.

Very disappointed. Have been there three times in the past year and every time we have been less than impressed.  This last trip is it for us.  My chicken was cold and rubbery, the chicken tenders were awful, and they have no scotch! These guys are on a one year ban for me - hopefully by then they can get their kitchen and bar in order during that time.

I have now experienced first hand why the new Chillis in Upland Colonies has a 2-1/2 star rating on Yelp first hand - bad management! You really can't succeed when the manager says "I will take 10% off of your bill," only to find that it is $1.56 that has been deducted for the 2 appetizers you ordered, yet ordered many other things. And when Christine, the Manager was asked about it, she claimed she told us "appetizers" not "bill"...as if a person could mistake the two words. (Shaking My Head) horrible character to lie to someone's face not once, but TWICE!
Worked out for my needs, wanted a beer and some quick grub.  Service was great even tho they were closing soon as I was not rushed.  One of the better Chili's I have been to.

Hi! The service was OK, the atmosphere was pleasant and the restaurant appears to be clean. the food is another matter. The managing partner should apologize for the incredibly mediocre food...right up front...but I guess that's kinda expected from a chain that controls food cost straight from the freezer...sad to say. I tried the unlimited enchilada's. They are friggin' frozen! The corn tortilla is NOT cooked in oil to make it soft just warmed under broiler or microwave. It was just tough and chewy even after sending it back. Now I know why all the reviews complain. Go for a drink or a desert -  because they are supposed be cold and frozen. If we're incorrect maybe the owners will respond?

Very slow service! Don't order the unlimited salad and soup, you'll never get a second round unless you have more than an hour to burn. If you're hungry, go somewhere else. Servings are small on some dish. The cocktails are very pricey. There's plenty of options in the area.

I really don't know how this place stays in business. I've given this place a couple chances and EVERY time I've had SLOW horrible service. 3 tables that came in after us got their food. Manager asked how we were doing and I said "upset" because we had not got our food. He asked me what he could do, uhhh maybe go check on our food or offer us chips and salsa to hold is over??? That guy is definitely NOT manager material. Would not want him running my place. Needless to say we will not be returning.
Food is alright. But service can be better. The place is empty no waiter in sight to check on you and its like good luck trying to wave someone down.

Brand new location & so far I'm still not impressed. :/ I have to start by saying, first & foremost, the menus are GROSS! I HATE touching them! Sticky and food in the folds. YUCK! I usually go wash my hands after ordering it's that bad. The self-serve computers at each table are just as questionable, with visible finger smudges, drips & (most likely) germs from children's dirty fingers. Bleach wipe much? Its about 80% of the time, when seated, there is some type of food or crumbs at the table or on the seats. I often wonder if they even care anymore when cleaning up. For such a new location it's truly no better than half the other locations.  So, why do I come here you ask??? The 3 C's: It's close, cheap & casual. I prefer sitting in the bar over the restaurant. They have pretty good drinks & you can order from the same menu. My favorite item is the chicken tacos & I usually order them. Cocktails are always spot on so that's a plus also.

Slow service, slow food delivery, Undercooked food, sent back. I could have done better at home myself, going to Ralph's Deli, or going to McDonald's. Now I know why I never come here. Very lower bourgeoisie.....

Went to this Chilis in Upland for the first time last week. We got there around 9:30 because we went to see the Revenant prior. Started at the bar and sat for 20 minutes, no service so we asked to move to the dining area. The waiters and waitresses were so anxious to get off that the brooms were flying and we were actually asked if we would mind moving to another booth so they could clean our area. We decided to leave as our welcome mat was no longer out. Not impressed!

I was super impressed with our server (Jerome?) as he was attentive, funny, and checked in with us  just the right amount of times. I got a blended margarita which was delicious--strong and sweet, just the perfect combo. The drinks came fast with waters which was nice cause usually you have to ask for water. The food was Chillis food-- we knew what we were getting and knew it was gonna be chain-restaurant food. I enjoyed mine, however the fries were not great.  I'm solely giving 4 stars based off the attentive waiter we had.

This Chili's location is fairly new to the area and is very convenient/cheap for a meal. The decor inside/outside is nice. The atmosphere is nice. When we walked in we were greeted and seated right away. There was four of us and we got a booth in the bar area.  First and foremost, our table was absolutely disgusting. There were crumbs left over from the previous people and dirty napkins/straws hidden in one area. My menu was pretty sticky as well. Pretty gross.  For our entrees, I ordered a Bottomless Soup & Salad which came with Chips & Salsa, Cream of Potato Soup and a House Salad w/ Honey Mustard Dressing. My boyfriend ordered a Prime Rib Bowl, and his parents ordered a Burger w/ French Fries.  My meal arrived a good 10-15 minutes before everyone else who was at the table and it got cold. It should have been presented with the other entrees too.  Secondly, my salad was very old. The spinach and lettuce was wilted and the cucumbers were old as well (photo below). It was very unappetizing. The Cream of Potato soup had barely any potato chunks and was mostly liquid.  My boyfriend and his parents enjoyed their meals very much, and that is the only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars and not 2.

The service was lousy I was overcharges for guacamole and chips , my salad came first I ordered soup first and it was wrong soup brought and then the new soup was cold and my server didn't check back w me thru my meal and my table was never pre busses !!!! Not great experience

Parking:  Private lot next to Panera and Baby's R Us. Service:  Mediocre, the waitress worked hard but it took 15 minutes to get our drinks Food:  This is where the review hits a low point.  After being there for nearly 1 hour, our appetizers finally came out.  We had to leave due to poor service and overall bad timing.  No manager ever came by to smooth things over or apologize, just an awful restaurant and a terrible experience.   I am beginning to think these reviews for national chains are like barking at the wind.  But if anybody does notice, please do not come to this Chili's. 1-star at the most.

The food is what you would expect from a Chili's. It's OK. I however, have been on a soup kick lately and their chicken enchilada soup is what I have been craving lately. Since we live very close, this is an easy option for dinner for us. We always order to-go since we have a newborn at home. That being said... The to-go service is HORRIBLE. Every time- and I mean every single time there is an issue with our order when we arrive to pick it up. The first time sides were missing, then we started checking our order. Now every time we check our order there is something wrong. And never order beef unless you love it either raw or super well-done. Those are the only two temperatures the food ever comes out at!

Love the new location, we go there frequently and have tried several different dishes....always tasty. Love the menu additions. I particularly like the flavor of their spicier choices - the Chipotle TexMex bowl is currently my fave.

Very modern, clean & good service.  It's an attractive spot to eat with family & friends during sports games so there tends to be a wait, plus the location is great in the nice shopping center and easy access off the freeway.  Parking can be hard to find with the neighboring restaurants.
food was ok .. beer was cold and wonderful... courtney was amazinggggg!! Nice happy hour :)

Took 15 min to seat a party of 5 when there were several  booths visibly available. Waitress was not very attentive. Was completely absent for a 15 min span. Tried to get other waitress' attention but that was unsuccessful. Also, the salmon was way overcooked,  chicken tenders were too crispy, and the vegetables were soggy. Probably won't be back to this chili's location

It's Chili's, what can you say. I've never been a big fan of Chili's but it's quick and easy sometimes and my kids really like the queso bean dip thing. Also, there haven't been any sit down restaurant options in this area so you kind of have to take what you can get.  I've probably been here 5 or 6 times since it opened and we've used the curbside to go service several times.  That being said, I've NEVER had prompt service here and today is probably the worst offense.  We were seated for 10-12 min before anyone came to take our drink order and that was after I flagged the server down. I'll give home credit, he's been trying hard since but this is just par for the course here. The table next to us left 20 min ago and it hasn't been cleared or cleaned yet and this is a busy night. I'm giving it 3 stars because the food is always at least decent, but it is just Chili's; not many options, EVERYTHING has their stupid chile lime stuff in it, and the service is horrible at this location.

well, as the saying goes you get what you pay for. really disappointed, came here late when most places were already closed, and was craving a good cheese burger. wasn't asking for much. I would have been happier going to a Micky d's though. the burger was memorably one of the worst burgers I've had. It almost didn't even look like real meat. it was grisly, tough, and not juicy. the service was okay, otherwise I would have given them one star for the food.

I'm not a fan of bring restaurants down because I do like to give second chances. the first time I went there a couple of weeks ago, it took some time for the food to get us.  But after telling the lady in the front that we were on a lunch break, the second time we went there, the food came in pretty fast. The bad part was, it might have been too fast. Afterwards when the group of us went back to work, 3 out of 5 had food poisoning  lasting two-three  days. Luckily, I was spared for such an event.  On a brighter note, the waiter that was surving us was attentive and did a great job of serving us.

The service was terrible.   This is the slowest service i have ever seen!   We waited over 30 minutes to get our food.   It was not even a full restaurant.   I ordered a medium steak and it was well done.  We were introduced to 2 servers,  but only saw one...periodically, so why introduce the other server who ignored us???  I consistently had to ask for more water.   We won't ever come back here again!

Me and my boyfriend came here on Thursday March 3rd for dinner around 6pm. We sat on the patio outside and we had the most attentive, kind waitress. Servers like her should be complimented on their hard work! Wish I would've paid more attention to her name tag.

Filthy tables, poor food, and slow service! We went there today with my toddler and like many mothers do I pulled out my disinfecting wipes and cleaned the table in front of my toddler. The wipe should be disinfecting and not "cleaning" their tables! As you can see in my picture the wipe was covered with back dirt. We told the manager but he didn't seem to care. Then it took so long for our food to come. A table that was sat after us had their food come out way before. The children's chicken tenders came out so hot you couldn't touch them and were placed in front of the baby. Add to that the food was gross. Waste of money! Stay away if you want a clean place to eat.

Horrible customer service! Bartender served us one drink and NEVER came back. Was 30 minutes until i finally got up and asked for a manager,who did not even care. Was ignored by bartender and two lazy waiters hanging around the bar area talking and doing nothing. Eventually got up and left. I have NEVER EVER not given anyone a tip,but I sat there wanting to pay for more drinks,and to be ignored as if you dont even exist was so ridiculous. This location has serious customer service issues. First and last time there.

The only reason I am giving this particular 2 stars is because our server Daniel was amazing. So first let's talk about the skinny margarita that had way too much artificial sweetner in it....ugh. Then we ordered the combination enchiladas plate. Literally looked as if someone threw the food on the plate. I mentioned to the food runner that the presentation of the food did not look appetizing and I overheard him mimick me to the server. So basically just rude and unprofessional. I definitely will not be coming back.

Came here on a Wednesday afternoon and i have to say it was the best service I got at any Chilis. I live closer to the one in Rancho but was in the area for this location. We had two servers (sorry ladies forgot your name) but i promise they were so attentive with our drinks, food and making sure everything was okay. We received two vouchers from having horrible service at the one closest to me the manager here came to make sure everything was okay and assured him it wasn't this location. We also told him the ladies were exceptional!

Chilli's is...well Chilli's. You either like it or you don't. Being residents of Upland, we no longer need to drive to Rancho or LaVerne as we have our own brand new Chilli's restaurant in the colonies. We are fans of the restaurant and really enjoy their food. For the most part, this Chilli's was very much like any other but was decorated a bit different and much nicer. The food like usual, was very good as we had the two for $20 dinner of the 6 oz classic sirloin, Texas cheese fries and a few beers. What really surprised us was the beer selection was much better then we remembered with a fairly large choice of craft beers, something I think you all know about us by now. The one negative thing I will say is not even Chilli's fault. There is absolutely no parking in the colonies area that Chilli's resides. This goes on both during the day and in the evening and really is the fault of the City of Upland and their poor planning. The food was delicious, the beer was cold and the service was very friendly and outstanding! A very good reason to go back! So, if you like Chilli's restaurants come here to Upland and visit ours as we were very impressed with the food, beer and service of the employees.

Paid 11 dollars for some crap salad that wasn't fresh and welted . I got it to go the girls that helped me were very nice and friendly . but my salad was gross and won't be coming back because of it . :(
Lunch was great at Chili's on 19th in UPland yesterday.  The service was good, not a big crowd and everything was served professionally!  It's a nice place for lunch during the week!

One star because I had to.  Went there on  a Sunday about 9:15.  Only about three tables occupied and our food still took forever.   My glass day empty for about 20 minutes before I was asked if I wanted a refill.  This was after appetizers and before the meal so ut wasn't like we were ready to leave.  I added  a dinner salad and specified no cheese or tomatoes.   Got cheese anyway.  Ir was served as dinner came out.  Not good.   Food was marginal , waitress was good,  service was horrid
Every meal gas been great! Particularly enjoy the top sirloin with avocado and roasted tomatoes with light salad. Friendly fast service.

Great, great, great service. Almost didn't come here for dinner tonight because of the horrible rating. Glad we did. Certainly impressed with the friendliness and great service. Thanks Taylor for the great service.

Food was ok, took quite a bit to get the beer that I had ordered, when I received it, it was not what I ordered. Long wait for the correct beer to arrive.  The Ziosk at our table (the pay and entertainment station)  had been switched around to different tables. One couple ended up paying someone else's tab, our tab was lost in Ziosk land as well. The solution to the switch up of tab's for the people...One couple paid for the wrong tab and left, the other party was still finishing up dinner. The waitress laughed while explaining that the couple that left, ended up paying the higher tab. She had the remaining couple pay the other tab, which was less then their own. Be careful with these things....

I have been to this chillis at least 10 times. We ate at the bar area 3 times because it gets so  busy.  I was wondering why there were so many empty tables with a 45 minute wait. Apparently they don't have enough server's.  So we eat at the bar when there's no tables. We had the worse service from the bar. On 3 different occasions the service was terrible.

Service at bar was awful. Bartender didn't want to wipe down bar unless she knew we were eating there. Who does that?? Had to ask her 3 times to wipe down the counter so my friend can sit down I was already seated and she ignored our request to wipe down the counter and kept saying are you going to eat here do you know what you want  terrible we ended up leaving went somewhere else that really wanted our business thanks chilis will go to the other one in Rancho

Me and my family always come to this chilis because it usually always has great customer service! But not this time.. Our waiter was horrible, Diana, I don't know if she was just new or what but I had to ask for everything! We ordered chips and salsa and then a house salad and asked for it to come out before our food well by the time we were already half way done with our DRINKS our chips and salsa and salad still didn't come! But our waiter was just walking around passing us like we weren't even there! I had to stop her while she was passing to ask for our chips! She then brought out our chips and again I had to ask her for the house salad! Our food soon came out after that, not once after did our waiter come back to our table she didn't give us any refills on our empty drinks she didn't come see if we needed anything else or any dessert or any boxes! I then again had to stop her while she was passing to ask for our dessert and some boxes! At that point we just had it we asked for our dessert to go and paid our bill and left probably one of the worst tips anyone can leave someone! I'm very disappointed on the service today because this was the reason we go to that particular Chilis to eat! If we ever go back again and get that same waiter I will most definitely ask to be seated somewhere else and be serviced by someone else!

We have been here a number of times hoping for a good experience. Still waiting.... Restaurant has a nice layout and the outside bar is cool.  The food is okay. We usually always order the ribs and the meat this time did not come off the bones very easy. The salsa tasted like old tomatoes not like the yummy salsa we usually get.

This is to probably  the worst chili I have been too they take forever to sit you and worst of all when you are waited to be seated they will act like no one is their and ignore you food takes forever do not come here

A nice addition to the area with an indoor/outdoor bar perfect for summer time. The food is okay.. the queso dip and salsa are the only two appetizers I would recommend, the rest isn't that great. Drink wise, they have your bottom basic beer on tap, nothing worth noting. However, their margaritas are pretty tasty. What really destroys this place is the employees. Some aren't very friendly or attentive. This part annoys me at times. And for some, it seems they really have to make an effort to be friendly.

Third time at this specific Chilis, never really great service, food usually good tho. Today we went for lunch and had a total of THREE waiter/waitresses serving our table, we  only had 2 adults and one child. We saw each one Once the whole time, for drinks, to order, and to receive our meals. No refills, no checking if we needed anything else, nothing! I had to waive down the hostess to find one of our waiters for a refill finally. Fries were stale, Arnold Palmer had no flavor to it. Just a dissapointing experience overall.

let me start by saying if there was a no star option I would have rather chose that, this place is TERRIBLE! from the service you get, to the atmosphere and vibes you get from that place. I've been there 4-5 times and they have messed up my order every single time. managers never offered to comp me one time. today I went and there was a hair in my food, didn't get offered a comp then either. had to wait for it to be cooked again while my other orders were sitting there getting cold. if you don't look a certain way in there, they treat you any kinda way. I don't know if it's flat out racism but it's darn close(but that part isn't fully their fault, the patrons stare like they don't think you belong.) my advice, choose anywhere else to eat.

Chili's is usually a fun experience for us but our visit here in Upland has not been the usual. Food takes a long time to arrive,  entrees arrive almost cold, drinks are slowly refilled, and food ingredients don't taste fresh.  I usually love this place.  I think staff and management needs more fine tuning.

Jeezus. So, we walk in. There's a freakin' restaurant full of empty booths, and the hostess says, "Do you mind a half booth/half chair"? Why? Why would anyone do this? Ya, I get it, in 1/2 hour there are going to be parties of 4+ coming in for dinner. But, that's no excuse. I'm here NOW, and no, I don't want a chair. I want a booth. So, she seats us at a tiny booth right next to the kitchen. Of course minutes go by without anyone coming, even for a drink order. Finally waiter comes, he's not well trained, he doesn't know the menu. We order, and it takes freakin' forever for the food to come. My hot chicken club is cold. I told him I didn't want it, nor pay for it. Just such a lousy experience. The second time in two days I didn't leave a tip. And I NEVER do that. I seriously can't remember the last time I didn't leave at least some tip. And twice in two days? I'm not that heartless, usually. But sheez, what a suck-fest.

We ordered food to go this evening.  The food was great, but the service from Taylor was even better! She gave us her recommendations, she double checked our bag to make sure we had everything, and she went above and beyond! Thank you!

Since this Chili's had just opened, I thought everything about it was going to be great. I walked in with my family, and it looked great. The atmosphere was great. We should have walked out then, because looking in the dining area and I saw 4-5 booths that were empty and hadn't been cleared. It didn't strike me as something to be concerned about. So we signed in, the wait time was going to be 15 minutes. We waited in the restaurant, got seated, no problems there. Waitress took a while to get to us, but she seemed swamped. Let me make one thing clear: our waitress was very apologetic about everything that happened and was the best waitress we've had in a while. We got our order in around 6 pm, and it was busy. We figured it would take a while to get our food. My sister and I split the 2 for $35 deal, except I don't drink alcohol so I gave the drink to her friend. The margaritas came and my sister's drink literally had a couple long, brunette hairs in it. She isn't a brunette. I guess the GM - I'm not exactly sure who he was honestly, but he wasn't dressed like a server - overheard it and said he would cut the price in half. Awesome! What he didn't say was that it was half off the margaritas, not the whole meal like he implied. As part of the meal, we ordered fried pickles, and when the other appetizer came out the waitress said they were out of fried pickles, but they were working on finding some. When the order came out, the 'fried pickles' consisted of five fried pickle chips and the rest (the size of an order of french fries) was just fried bread crumbs. Like really? Is that normal, or is that what they threw together? I don't know if the kitchen was swamped or what, but we didn't get our meal until 30 minutes later. It felt like forever. I got the fajitas cadillac style, which means you get a side of rice and beans. It also came with cheese, sour cream, among other things. The sour cream was warm and separated - not creamy at all. The rice and beans with both of our fajitas were cold, and the tortillas weren't plentiful. I felt like I had to keep asking for tortillas and by the time the second batch came, my chicken was cold. Overall, I am very dissatisfied with this Chili's location and will not be returning until improvements are made.

Misleading. They have an insert menu specific to bragging about how much pride they have in their 30 years of smoking ribs. Oh how the pictures show ribs on a rack and a pile of pecan logs a temp gauge at 200` , and I'm thinking hell yeah, they're gonna be like mine. Welp, I swear them ribs were boiled and lathered in bbq sauce. No smoke ring, no nothing. I don't believe they even have a smoker, and if they do, what the hell time do you have to go in to get the smoked ones? And by the way,  what's up with the under cooked fajitas? Dear Lord, at least the beer was cold.
The Chili's is Chili's but there is an AMAZING server named COURTNEY who has the best customer service. I was very Happy.

I have not been to a chilis in over 8 years, since my last bad experience in the Rancho Cucamonga chilis on foothill, when our food arrived cold and stiff and then, the server sneezed all over it, and didn't bother to get new food for us, just said "sorry," and the manager was not available to talk to about our bad experience. We paid the bill without touching the food, and left. So, understandably, you can imagine my lack of enthusiasm when my teenagers suggested for us to have dinner there at the upland colonies chilis. But, I reluctantly went anyway, having high hopes and extremely low expectations.  When we got there, it was clean and well maintained. We were greeted by a friendly hostess and seated immediately in a comfy booth. We ordered the two for twenty and our appetizer arrived in a short amount of time. It was hot, looked delicious, and was tasty and plentiful. Then the entrees arrived. The steak was delightful. The Chili's hamburger is one of the best- even rivals Vegas or in n out's. I just love love love this place. Everything is good. Everyone is nice. If you don't think those things are good at this upland colonies chilis, you do not want to go to a different local chilis. We have gone back to chilis now at the colonies only. So glad they got one in our area now.
Use to visit here at least once a week. No thanks, place has gone downhill big time. Service isn't as good, food is always cold and dry. I'm over it
Very disappointed tonight. My daughter ordered a pizza it came out completely burned.  We sent it back and we were done eating by the time it came back out and they still charged us!

This is really like two different restaurants, so I chose a star rating in the middle. If the restaurant isn't busy, the service is awesome and the food is really good. Everything is served promptly and at the correct temperature, the wait staff is highly attentive and refills drinks regularly along with checking to see if anything is needed, and the restaurant is clean.  If the restaurant is crowded, the service sucks and the food is awful.    Food sits under warming lamps until it's completely dried out and barely lukewarm, the wait staff is running around like chickens with their heads cut off, and there's stuff all over the floor. Big hit or big miss.  Management needs to get things under control to better handle crowds.

Ordered the Santa Fe Salad.. The ratio of dressing to salad greens was way over powering, the salad was a wet salad. Service was great, just not the food. And the drinks were so weak. I ordered a margarita and it tasted like straight juice.
We like the food. Went early, 4:30 and stood there for at least 10 minutes. No hostess anywhere. We walked out and went to Oggi's.

Customer service totally SUCKS!!!! Today food was just OK THIS location was not at the top of there game today I think this calls for a DM , JP! Visit think I'm going to the heights ;-( and OMG My server just walked out CRAZY

This restaurant just keeps going down hill, the customer service is trash, the food isn't always cooked, & the waiting time for everything to be on your table is at least an hour plus. I used to eat here weekly but everytime it's constantly something wrong. Today my mom's steak wasn't cooked, we asked to send back and cook it after about 25 minutes they came back and said we'll cook a new one, another 45 minutes went by and we were all done eating. My mom got the steak and it was still trash, hardly cooked again we even got charged for another steak and had to wait for the manager to come and take it off our receipt which also took about 15 minutes. Don't get me wrong it wasn't the waitresses fault, it was just another horrible experience at chilis.

You know, we have been to this newer Chillis location a few times since it opened not that long ago. We continued to come back because the service at this particular location was always above average compared to most. Service is the main reason people come back to a chain restaurant,  everyone knows that. So what the HELL happened this time Cody?  We brought a party of 8 on Saturday afternoon. Light crowd, plenty of servers on hand. So you would think things would go well, WRONG!!!!!! After we were seated we were told we would have three servers for our group and then one came over and delivered their wonderfully prepared statement. Saying she was one of our servers but our main waitress will be there shortly. We never heard from her or the third alledged server from the grassy knoll again!!!!! Our main waitress came by and said it was her second day ( the exact person you would assign for a party of 8, come on  Cody, really?) And she struggled to keep up. Now I get that she was new and I have no problem with that. But give the girl some support like your prepared statement said you would.  Well the kitchen staff must be under Cody's management also because our food came over in delayed sections. Our 2 year old  grandson was supposed to get a kids pepperoni pizza and they brought it without any pepperoni on it. Literally 25 mins later they brought the correct pizza. Great now we are all almost finished eating and we have to wait for a two year old to finish eating.  The corn of the cob (which I love) I ordered did not arrive with my meal. It arrived 25 minutes later with my grand son's pizza. You know, if would have got my corn on the cob in a timely manner, I probably would never have written this review. You see Cody, even the simple things matter. Well, the manager Cody came over and  asked how things went. I told him each thing that went wrong with our meal. All he said was " sorry......... sorry ........and sorry". Great, that made things better, thanks Cody for those heartfelt words. We will remember that the next time we come back......NOT!!!!!. Our server came over and apologized again ( at least she meant it) and I asked her if the manager was having a bad day. She must of mentioned it to him because he came back to our table as we were leaving and asked if I had something else I wanted to say. This.time with a little attitude (must have struck a nerve with him). I said no, nothing else say to you but you can check out my yelp and Google reviews if he would like.   Now my dear old grammy always used to say,  " never get into a verbal or physical confrontation with the managerly challenged". Good thing huh Cody,  The search for a well run Chillis's continues..............

Service is ok. Not really on top of things. The wait is long. The food took a while to get. The rice and beans came out after our meal. We asked a few times to change the TV to the opening of the Olympics and the TV was never changed. The food was good though.

I was here last week for lunch with my friend. Things started off fine but went downhill fast! We ordered 2 appetizers to share for lunch. When our waiter brought our food we asked for the bill as we had to pick up kids from school in a while. He never came back to our table again. Never refilled our drinks, checked on our meal....NOTHING!!! We asked the shift manager to get our bill for us after nearly 15 minutes of looking for our waiter, she quickly brought us the bill. After 5 minutes I tracked her down again asking her to take care of our payment since we were in a hurry now and he was nowhere in sight still, so she said sure. A few minutes later she comes out with a big group to sing happy birthday to a table without doing our bill first. My friend now had to leave so she wouldn't be late to pick up her special needs child. The waiter reappeared 5 minutes later saying she gave him this money from us and did I need change....we gave the lady a $50 for a $30 meal and he asks if I need change!?!? I simply said yes and that I was now late to get my daughter from her school. He had the nerve to tell me that wasn't his fault. I took my change and left to pick up my daughter. I called the restaurant about an hour later to talk with a manager and had to leave a message. I called one more time and still have not had my call returned!!! I will never step foot in this place again. Never have I had such terrible service!!!! One star is way to good for this location.
Love coming here! The bar area is really nice :) service could be a little more prompt, depending who you get.

Sarah and Jerry our bartenders were spectacular! Very tentative and got our food out quick along with delicious drinks! When we were done they handled our bill promply and with a cheerful disposition.

This Chili's is clean and has a upscale feel. They have great servers, but I always request Courtney. I come weekly and sit in the bar area. The food is delicious and so are the drinks. I used to go to the chilis in Rancho and switched to this one because it feels a lot cleaner.

We waited 15 min with no one looking at us or talking to us. Four different staff members delivered food and took orders at the tables next to us. There are many Chilis in this area - east 210/north 15 - do NOT go to this one. Terribly unprofessional.

It was really good deal for entrees for 22 Including the salads was a lot of food.  The price go up still good for a family night. I really I enjoy it. Not too many people maybe coz it was at 10 in the evening.

Ok had a mistake with my dinner but the manager cleared it up! It was fantastic service. Daddy daughter date night and Saturday in the bar area so I can watch football and she can play games. Her Caribbean Salad with shrimp was wonderful, they had mistake with my guacamole burger but they were good about correcting it. My waiter was amazing and friendly his name was Derek so if you ever get him, you are very lucky.   I had a great night with great service.

Tonight we decided to stop and have dinner here before going to T-mobile, and let me tell you, biggest mistake ever! we got there at 5:30 and decided to sit in the bar section. We ordered the 2 for $35 which included a Cadillac margarita and oddly enough came in a regular drinking glass, not the one shown in the menu. She tells me it's because they are all being used, yet we could clearly see stacks of them!! If it was simply because we ordered off the 2 for $35 menu she cld of just said that. Instead she gave me a BS excuse. After sitting there for 20 min got our salad but she brought the wrong salad dressing. Then we waited another hour. At 6:40 we saw a friend an owner of another restaurant talking to the owner of Chillies. My Fiancé went to talk to him. Once we did that, we had a manager at our table within 5min. He refreshed our margaritas since they literally tasted like the mixer. When we got our food it was cold so I told the manager that fajitas are supposed to come out on a hot plate and he snapped back with, "did you try them?" I said no. The fact that he said that means he knew they were not up to par!! He tells me he will go "warm it up" instead of making me a new one! We were there 2hrs and they did nothing to make the experience better! Worst experience ever, we won't be returning!!

Horrible ToGo Service!!!  My wife ordered the other day food and received horrible customer service. She pre-ordered online and was instructed the food would be ready in 20 mins. She arrived 30 mins later. After standing in the lobby, no one offered to help her immediately. They advised the employee who does ToGo's was arriving momentarily and he would help her. We couldn't understand why another server could not help us.  After about 10 mins, the "ToGo" employee arrived and stated it would take him another 5-10 mins to prepare the food. Shouldn't the food already have been ready?! We surprised us was the lack of teamwork this location has. Why wouldn't another employee help with our order. Now we had to suffer our food being cold due to their laziness. When we asked commented to our manager that our food may be cold for waiting that long he didn't seem to care. He advised it had been sitting under the warmer and he couldn't do anything about us waiting so long. Of course by the time we got home all our food was Cold!  During another incident when we order ToGo they have gotten our order wrong. That is very frustrating when you arrive home and it is not correct. What's wrong with this location!!!!!!????? We love Chili's very much and sucks that this is the closes one. Horrible customer service!! DO NOT ORDER TOGO From this location!!!

I cannot give this place any stars, but the app is making me!! Since they have opened I have been here 4 times....each experience has been... bad, this time by far the worst. Waitress was super nice as well as the server, however, our food was a disaster!! They messed up my salad, yes a salad. They return it and I swear they got the lettuce out of the trash! The lettuce was super soggy and not with dressing!! Soggy old sitting out for ten days soggy! My daughter order pasta and there were literally uncooked noodles on her plate!!! WTF! I wish I could stop there... my boyfriends fajita trio.... wasn't sizzling on the way out (of course who cares but isn that their signature?) anyway, the steak tasted microwaved and was rock hard! I can't make this stuff up! Manager comped my salad and gave us free desert. Can't expect much more I guess...... don't come here..... they need a major adjustment. I have never had a good experience here. I guess we will being going to Montclair going forward.

Have frequented this location about 10 times now sat in the bar most times and the dining area once.  Came in on a packed Sunday and was served very very quickly . Every single table in that restaurant was occupied no joke.  Was seated within 20 seconds of walking through the door.  The staff was very attentive the greater server guy with the blonde hair was very friendly and I think my server was Stephanie with curly black hair she was a complete doll so fast friendly and accommodating the food was hot and to my liking and even when ordering drinks from the bar they came out very quickly ( the one in Laverne takes forever ) overall I highly reccomend this location

Horrible service it took almost an hour just to get our sampler platter we only ordered two . Then we wanted  to order lunch that took forever. Will  never go back. the waitress was running  around like a chicken with head cut off. And the restaurant wasn't even busy.

Horrible with to-go orders. On the few occasions I have placed a to-go order here my experience has always been the same unpleasant and unsatisfactory.  1. Less than stellar (or even average) customer service. I have experienced walking in to the designated "to-go" pick up area only to be met by no one and waiting around 8 minutes - with multiple employees walking by to get to the back portion without asking if I had been helped - until I was finally asked for the name of my order.  2. Disorganized - on another occasion I placed an order only to walk in and pick it up 15 minutes later to be told that they were out of what I had ordered and looked confused as to why I didn't know that citing someone should have called. I can understand that sometimes things get lost in the shuffle. But it was not busy at all and the worker did not seem to care much about the mixup.  All in all, would definitely not recommend ordering to-go at this location.

My daughter and I had the most wonderful visit today. I wish I kept the receipt so I would know our servers name. I believe she said it was Breanna, but my hearing is terrible. She mentioned she goes to cal state fullerton if that helps in case the managwrs happen to read this. Both waitresses were absolute amazing and their customer service was beyond excellent. From the cheerful attitude to the small talk we engaged in, was all an absolute delight. The food was delicious and the strawberry lemonade was out of this world amazing. We will definitely come back to this location. It was by far money well spent. My absolute compliments to the chef, the amazing servers and who ever came up with the idea of putting the silverware in the paper bags is a genius. Love that idea. Thank you all!

Went in and host told us 10 mins. 20 mins later no table and he was seating people that came in after us. Half the restaurant was empty and the host was even running food and cleaning tables. Very disrespectful seating other same size parties ahead of us. Poorly managed establishment, plenty other places to eat around this place that treated us a lot better.

It was Friday night my family decided to try this chill's , Our waiter Alex was very friendly with great attitude, I had a coupon for a free appetizer which I saved it on my smart phone, Alex was not sure to except  that coupon or not  because it was picture of it , so he went to his "Supervisor" . this gentleman maybe was one of the cook , he came from kitchen , anyway he  firmly said NO , Our total bill was about $150 and the cost of appetizer was $8.99 it was not a big deal however we were not treated professionally by " Supervisor" Food was good , we divided to visit other Chillies in future.

Place is definitely a hit or a miss. If you see people waiting inside for longer than 5 minutes, pack it up and turn around because you're not in for a good experience. However, if it's not busy, stop in the place is usually pretty good with it's service and food. Went in with my parents for dinner, sat in the bar to avoid the 20-minute wait and tonight was a bad night, we got our drinks and we weren't ready to order, so the waitress said she'd be back in a few, and then waited 20 minutes for her to come back. She took our order and then we waited about another 30+ minutes for our food, which was lukewarm.  The restaurant looked understaffed which could be the issue here, but in that case I would just like to see a little more communication from the waitstaff.  I'll be going back because it's not bad food, just sometimes a bit unorganized.
I will never be eating at this location again. Ordered the appetizer platter and and ended up with raw chicken. Disgusting, please save yourselves and don't eat here.

I leave 1star only because the option of none is unavailable. Ordered 'to go' today...the Chipotle Chicken Bowl..ew, the lettuce was super rotten. Like black rotten. The enchilada soup was so basic, it's usually my fav. The salsa from the chips & salsa was suuuuuupppppeeeeerrrr watery with no flavor. The appetizer platter had the southwest eggrolls, boneless buffalo wings & big mouth bites. One of the eggrolls had completely unrolled while frying & was like a deep fried square. The boneless buffalo wings were cold & they only gave us ranch as dipping sauces. I don't get it. Isn't this a fairly new location?! I love the LaVerne location & will NEVER be coming back here.

My family and I went in on a Thursday night. The place was very crowded.  In spite of this we were seated very promptly.  The staff was cordial and friendly. Our server Krystal was very attentive and pleasant.   Our drinks and appetizers were delivered quickly which was a pleasant surprise because of how packed the restaurant was.  Our dinners were also brought out expeditiously.  Throughout our evening, Krystal came by to have our drinks refilled.   Thank you for making our evening a pleasant and memorable experience.  We will definitely be returning in the near future.

Service was horrible on all aspects. We walked in and sat at the bar. Ordered 2 beers and it took about 5 minutes to get those. The bartender was talking with someone just taking her time. We ordered our food. It was good. We asked for a box after we finished. It took probably took another 5 minutes and no check so we asked the girl for the check. She printed it out and just handed it to us without saying a word.  The problem is the service is poor and the employees act like they don't want to be there.  They seem to avoid eye contact at all cost. They are just not personable.

ordered a margarita it came to me with NO liquor in it, As a professional bartender i know how to make a margarita.If you order a alcoholic drink here order it with the liquor on the side so the bartender will not CHEAT you.

Walked in 1 hour and 15 minutes before closing.... no hostess to greet. So my husband and I decided to go to the bar 5 dirty tables (no where to sit) we walk to the bar area the empty seats had dirty dishes. No one at bar area said hello. We saw 2 bartender at least 5 waitresses "cleaning" the other side and restaurant and no one said hello!!!! Dirty, not friendly, and should be providing service for at least 1 more hour. Goodbye!! Taking our money else where.

Didn't understand why we ended up with horrible service. First of all, everything started well. We were seated quickly and orders we placed in a timely manner. Approximate wait for reviving our food was about half hour. Let alone we beat the happy hour and dinner crowd. I'd asked two servers for napkins and never received them. Our server disappears and have to ask someone to find our server. Hope this review can help other yelp viewers . I'm no longer returning to this establishment for it's poor performance. Thank you but no thank you!!!

Always have issues here. Haven't been in awhile so I thought it would be different, but the stars don't lie. The waiter Jerry was physically there but not there. From the second we walked in there, it looked like his dog had died, and he acted like it. He acted like he did not want to work at all and he was having the worst day of his life.  He also unattentive, I had to ask for menus, I had to ask for refills on my drinks, and I had to ask what drinks were on special at the time. Not only was the waiter rude and uninviting, but he gave me a chipped glass, that cut my finger. This place is horrible.

Courtney was our bartender and she was so attentive and friendly! I couldn't believe how great my experience was. My date wouldn't even look me in the eyes, so he sucked. But I don't blame him, she was bangin!! Thanks Courtney
Great service, server was Hannah, quick service, food was good. Overall good meal and good experience

I wanted to say we had excellent experience here with your server named Joe 2 times now. He takes care and effort to get to know us and remember our orders. He does this with everyone and his demeanor is so nice to see him it's like having a friend and dining at their house. We have a Chili's near us but we travel to this location just to have him for our server once a month. Great server! Give this guy a raise.

We have ordered to go and eaten in the restaurant a few times. We ordered To-go tonight and are extremely disappointed.  $5.29 for each kids meal and we ordered three. Each container had grilled cheese and about 8 fries. I won't be going to this Chilis again
Came here for lunch today with my sister. Service and food was amazing. Krystal was a great server!! Jalapeño margaritas were excellent! I'll be back for sure!

The chips and salsa are pretty good. The wait can be long but it's not bad afterward. The soups are better at this location and they take time to give you a decent service. Of the chillis we go to, this one is pretty decent.

Pretty Nice place if you want to sit down be waited on for a decent price and atmosphere. I've always been treated good at chili's, never 100% but I've never felt kicked to the curb. This place is no different, this is my go to choice when I want to sit down and eat with waiter service at the colonies. Solid, good stuff!

On the way back to LA from Palm Springs and we needed a place to eat. Chili's was a quick and convenient option so we went ahead and went there. It was fairly empty and we were seated right away. Ordered the nachos to start. They were good - an interesting take on nachos as they were sort of deconstructed. I ordered the BBQ burger with a veggie patty and no bacon - sub fries for onion rings. The rest of the table split a plate of ribs and a salad. My burger was tasty - the black bean patty was 100% the ones they sell at Costco because the flavor was too familiar, but I'm not complaining. Onion rings were nice and crispy, as were the french fries. The rest of my family seemed to be satisfied with the ribs. Service was good as well. An overall good meal,  but not worth 4 stars from my end because of the limited vegetarian menu options.

I'm writing a five star review to cancel our the haters. This is a strongly ran establishment that is a finger off a large corporation. The bar staff is the only staff I have had the pleasure to be served by. No matter who is here, or what their position is it seems everyone has each other's back. Happy hour is on point, and even the patio bar gets used, and if it's not open, just ask, the bartender would love to open up more tabs!! Bring your office co-worker, bring your family, heck bring only yourself like me, and your beverage will be continually refilled and the food served hot! Thank you bar crew!!!

Food was good and the atmosphere was relaxing.  The restaurant was busy but the reason we Will be back is our server.  Melissa Tschoepe. She was awesome and worked her tail off to accommodate our family.  She gets a personal 5.
Service is bad at this location. Except to wait for everything Larry the manager needs to step up his game. The staff is too laid back here. Go to the Rancho Cucamonga location instead.
Daniel did a great job of service and explained the change in management is making this Chilis much better for workers and customers.

"Welcome to Chilis, where it takes an hour just to be served your meal."  The service is disappointing. It's sluggish, sloppy, and shows me (a customer) their immense lack of care. Then you'd think that after an hour of waiting, the food would suffice. But it's nothing more than mediocre. Never again. This chilis puts all the others to shame.
The service was excellent, our waitress was courteous fast and efficient. The food was subpar. I don't think I will return to this location.

I am a very frequent customer at this Chili's and my favorite thing to order is the margarita grilled chicken. They have recently changed the chicken, but it looks and tastes like there's teriyaki sauce on it and seasoned the tortilla strips that are now like spicy Doritos. I'm really disappointed with it and won't be ordering this new version anymore (Margarita Gross Chicken). By the way, there was a bug in my friend's water.

Completely related to service. I would have given it no stars, but the food was tasty...even though it took us over an hour to get our dinner. First, drinks were wrong. Fine..not a biggie until 20 minutes later we still had not received new drinks AND only 2 of the 5 of us received water so needless to say, we were thirsty. Fast forward another 20 min...(so 40 min since we ordered) and no food. At this point, the waitress "Sierra"!said it was due to a sudden rush and kitchen back up. Problem with that excuse...it was a Mon night and the place was only half full. We ask our server again and she says it's a few min more and assures us appetizer will come before food. Well she was half right...1 min later app comes...as well as 1 person's meal. Problem with this besides the obvious that our appetizer is no longer such, is that 20 min later the rest of our party still has no food. Now server "Sierra" says it was a problem with the "input system"...a glitch. We are at an hour since ordering now. Ask to speak to manager and he says it was the server's fault as she failed to enter more than half our order and days she lied to us and asked him to cover but he told her "it's your problem"...hmmm...seems like as his server it's HIS problem. He rolls his eyes and literally sighs as he has to hear my sister complain. She's been a server for 30 years so she obviously had an opinion about all this. He says well don't worry...I'll get dessert for you and your food will be out in 5 min so like I told you, you'll get your food". Really??? Free dessert with a side of attitude??? On my b-day when I already get desert...wow...thanks. Fast forward another 15-20 min (well over an hour since ordering) still no food for 75% of our party. At this point we get up to leave. Manager begs us to say and now says he'll comp meal. We sit (can't pass up a free steak meal). Our server returns and continues the excuses and brushes off the situation stating it was just "one of those days" and "I try to treat my guests as I would like to be treated". Really Sierra?? Do you like to be lied to and pushed aside? By the way...she would disappear for literally 20 min at a time and we had 3 other fill ins. She does finally give a half hearted apology. Bottom line...yes stuff happens, mistakes happen...but being disrespected by BOTH the server and manager was a choice. WORST SERVICE EVER. Won't be back anytime soon. Such a disappointment.

So, just stopped for another last minute dinner and asked for Carley. She was here, but not working. We had the pleasure of having Shannon serve us. Amazing service again. This Chili's is by far has the best servers ever. You guys ROCK! Watch out Carley!
Great service Shannon has a great personalty. Hamburger and chicken strips were excellent.

This chili's is easy access off the 210 fwy in the Colonies shopping center. Parking is super easy with a huge shared lot.  This location is not packed like others, and you can usually get seated upon arrival. I have been to this location multiple times over the past couple years. The food is usually pretty good. The drinks are great. Happy hour is ALL day Sunday! The restaurant is clean. Service is slow at the bar and seated area.

Cheap lunch with a strawberry Margarita. Yeah! Josh mot only made the best margarita I have had in a long time. He was also the best waiter.  The service was awesome and so was the food.  All for $15  including tip.
Very good! Always our family favourite!! We love the egg rolls! I especially love the margaritas!

We went here with a big party, I get it.  But service was horrible,  food took forever and they kept messing up on our drink and food orders.  We asked for things and they never brought them.  Not returning to this location!
Feels like a second home. All of the servers are awesome and friendly -especially in the bar area (Derek and Taylor are always on point!)
Always great service, great atmosphere & yummy food! We can never go wrong with our Chili's in Upland!

Have visited numerous Chili's around So. California including the one I'm at as I write this here in Upland on 19th. I never have had any problems with Chili's but today I ordered a kid meal-mac n' cheese and it was SO dry. I hate anytime I have a complaint anywhere, I feel so bad for the servers but I mentioned it to ours and she was nothing but understanding and polite and took care of it right away. Love customer service like that. Hard to find!

Elected to try this new store nearby. We've been Chili's patrons for many years. I have to say, this store did an exceptional job on our first visit. Seated quickly and served promptly. Food was prepared perfectly; e.g. steak was perfect temperature. Thank you.

This my mom's favorite restaurant, her home away from home. We live a mile from the restaurant, so we are regulars. She always wants to sit in the bar, not because she drinks, but because some of the wait staff are like family to her, know her standard order by heart, and are kind and caring. Shout out to Hannah and Taylor, our favorites! Derek too!

Came here with my grandparents because they said they always wanted to try a chilis so I said why not?? I haven't been here in a while and it's still as great as it is! I believe our server was Miriam. She was super friendly and attentive and definitely made our visit a great one!! I don't live down here but my grandparents do and they definitely said they'd be back!
We love this Chilis. We typically sit in the bar area, Derek and Hannah are wonderful.

Courtney our server and bartender were great I have 10yrs bar experience and can say they are amazing! I came into watch an early football game with my son service and personality was flawless! Will be back on sundays from here on out! Great food great prices great service!
Great food and service.  The server was attentive and so helpful when the ziosk wouldn't work.  Food was very good

Recently, a few big chain restaurants have changed their menus a bit and Chili's is one of them. They have trimmed their menu, added a few items, and it seems like they've added some new drinks to their selection.  The new items are fantastic! On our most recent visit my wife had their potato soup and I had the Grilled Avocado Sirloin. My wife loved the soup and my dish was so good! Our server, Hannah, took good care of us and said that what I ordered was one of the most popular new items. It did not disappoint.  Keep up the good work!

Rude narrow minded to say the least seems food service TREATMENT is based on how they pre pick customers based on people at the table. Needless to say our waitress was Nice she apologized and picked up the slack for which the manager should had done which means she lives in the reality of this real  world of all people are humans who deserve to have great service and food.  Management team  Big epic Fail did not apologize for my old Greasy southwest egg rolls grabbed the tray walked away. My boyfriend ordered the same thing and they came out just great nothing like what I had I took note of all the food being served around me seems no one else had this problem seems like everyone else's food looked as it should.  Sure the response will be the same lame epic excuse everyone has a now days  but people really need to wake up grow up and get their heads out of their behinds and realize skin color doesn't matter people are people and people work hard and deserve to enjoy life and good times and eat good food not crap food or crap service based on how they look or who they're with. By the way every manager was walking around with the same rude nonchalant non-caring attitude on their face not helpful at all. The cold looks and service I received is a disgrace.  Continue to hope for change in this world people can be with who they want interracial love is Beautiful. All races of people beautiful

Came the evening of the first game of the World Series. Even though the place was pretty busy, the service was quick efficient and pleasant. One of the things that I like about Chili's is that there are television monitors which are viewable from many different locations in the restaurant. I had the fajitas, Which I ordered with a special request. Which was done perfectly the first time. Even though I said in the bar, I think next time I will sit in the dining room. Not a bad place to hang out during the series.

Convenient, comfortable place. Never over crowded. Food is well prepared and arrives fairly quickly. Love the burgers although they are known for their ribs. Fajitas are good but onions could be cooked a bit more to soften. Kids like the choices like sliders and corn on the cob. Usually too full for dessert. Truly a neighborhood bar & grill.
Always great service and good food.! The servers are so friendly. This is our "go-to" restaurant and they never let us down.

My husband enjoys their burgers and beers. However, the staff do not follow the specific request, ie. do not grill avocado.  My salad did not come out as it was advertised, only the greens and none of the  extra ingredients.

Disappointed in our poor service and undercooked food. From the minute we sat down we could tell our waitress was upset. We all ordered the fajitas and drinks. When the food arrived only 20% of the veggies were cooked. I requested for mine to be sent back and cooked more. She quickly took it without a response. When she returned she set it on the table with out a word. Our waters were not refilled and any interaction was met with rolled eyes. At one point my friend split her salsa and she came by to pick up the container and ran off without a word. We spoke to the manager Tim about our poor service. He was unprofessional and instead of simply apologizing shared how she was upset because she had to work late. He claimed other coworkers called out sick and she had a date planned. He then spoke to her and she later said to us, "Sorry you thought I was in a bad mood. Do you want some water?" At this point we closed our bill and left.

My boyfriend got food poisoning from them yesterday....he had the boneless chicken wings and it was the only thing he had eaten all day and nobody else had a piece...got home a few hours later he started throwing up, diarrhea, he fell asleep in the bathroom.DO NOT EAT HERE. I have never seen him in such pain.

Very disappointing!! I never got a chance to sit down because I waited at the hostess area and no one ever greeted me or acknowledged I was there!  Plenty of servers walked right by me and never said a word.  I just left; will never go back.  It wasn't even busy!  It was on 12/18/17 at 3:20pm!

Chili's is my absolute favorite restaurant. The southwest egg rolls, fried pickles, and sliders were so freaking good. I can't get enough. The corn on the cob with my meal was the best I've had. Our server was beyond sweet and did a fantastic job. I can't wait to go back.
